result.execSummary:
The defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all court costs, penalties and surcharges including DNA and victim witness surcharges to be paid by May 4, 2016 or a civil judgment.  Court ordered no license suspension.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deviell Dashawn Burks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Granting Defendant's Motion for Return of Property signed and filed.  Copies to the district attorney's office and defense attorney Towers.

Attorney Lawrence A. Towers in court, defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks not in court, in custody. City of Milwaukee Jennifer Rhodes Assistant Corporation Counsel and Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Joel Streicher Detective for the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office. Statements made by  counsel and petitioner.  Court grants petition.

Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks not in court with attorney Lawrence A. Towers. In Custody  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Return of property hearing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Return of property hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.  Plaintiff's Reply to Defendant's Brief in Support of Defendant's Motion for Return of Property.
Affidavit of Jasmine Reeves received and filed.
Defendant's Brief in Support of his Motion for Return of Property received and filed.

Attorney Lawrence A. Towers in court, petitioner Deviell Dashawn Burks not in court, in custody.  Jennifer K Rhodes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on property hearing.  Case is adjourned for continuation of return on property hearing in Branch 22 for defense to provide proof of income.  Return of property hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return of property hearing at 01-06-2016 01:30 pm
Milwaukee County Sheriff's Inventory #15000235.

Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO SENTENCING, STATEMENTS BY ALL PARTIES:
Court ordered defendant to pay all court costs, penalties and surcharges including DNA and victim witness surcharges to be paid by May 4, 2016 or a civil judgement.  Court ordered no license suspension.

Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

On state's motion, Court ordered charge amended to

Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)961.41(3g)(e), a Class U Misdemeanor.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed.
State's Witness List received and filed.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Parties are prepared for trial.  State's Motion in Limine Granted.  State's offer is revoked.

Telephone call received from Attorney Epps.  He will be out of State on the scheduled final pretrial date of 4-6-15.  Attorney requests matter be rescheduled to 4-8-15.  Attorney James Toran talked to the State earlier today about this same matter.  It appears that Attorney Toran has been retained on this matter.  Confirmation of this will be obtained on 4-6-2015
Defendant's Witness List

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Substitution of counsel signed and filed. Atty. Toran is now attorney of record. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 4/3/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 5/4/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in court with James Bowers, student intern under the supervision of attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in custody.  Ron Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF771 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Joel Streicher-MCSD Deputy.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Deviell Dashawn Burks in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
